pageContext.claim: “We had, by the way, a massive crowd [in El Paso]. And my competitor [Beto O’Rourke] had very few people, but the press didn't report it that way. … From what I hear, he had less than a thousand people. And we had a packed arena, and we had probably 25,000 people outside of the arena.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump overestimates his crowd size and underestimates the crowd for a competing rally held in El Paso by former Rep. Beto O'Rourke (D-Tex.). He claimed that the Fire Department permitted 10,000 in the arena, but a Fire Department spokesman said 6,500 people were inside the venue and denied any special accommodations were made. (Several thousand, though, were outside the Coliseum, watching the president's speech on big screens.) An O'Rourke spokesman said about 8,000 attended the counter-rally. However, the El Paso Police Department told the El Paso Times that officers had made no official estimates.
